title.narrative: Rwanda - Projet d’expansion de l’accès à l’énergie
Rwanda - Scaling Up Energy Access Project

description.narrative: Les principaux bénéficiaires du projet seront environ 25 438 ménages ruraux vivant dans les Provinces du nord (districts de Rulindo et Gicumbi) et de l'ouest (districts de Ngororero, Rusizi, Nyamasheke, Nyabihu et Karongi ), représentant environ 127 000 personnes. En outre, les infrastructures publiques seront sensiblement améliorées ; le projet donnant accès à une source d'énergie à la fois moderne et fiable à 179 écoles, 29 centres de santé et 25 bureaux d'administratifs sectoriels. Enfin, les marchés, les centres d'affaires et les autres grands utilisateurs se verront raccorder par ordre de priorité, en fonction du programme établi. Il est donc prévu que les petites entreprises ainsi que les quelques grands clients commerciaux et industriels de la région bénéficient également de ce programme.

The key project beneficiaries will be an estimated 25,438 rural households living in both Northern Province (Rulindo and Gicumbi districts) and Western Province (Ngororero, Rusizi, Nyamasheke, Nyabihu and Karongi districts), representing around 127,000 people.2 In addition, public infrastructure will be significantly improved, as the project will provide access to modern, reliable energy to 179 schools, 29 health centers, and 25 sector administration offices. Finally, markets, business centers, and other major consumers will be given priority in the routing as per the program design. It is therefore expected that smallscale businesses and the few large commercial and industrial clients located in the area will benefit from the program.

Le principal objectif du projet proposé est de soutenir la stratégie et le programme de développement à court terme et à long terme du Gouvernement du Rwanda (GDR). Les résultats attendus sont : (i) un meilleur accès à l'électricité pour les ménages et les institutions publiques prioritaires dans la zone du projet proposé et (ii) un approvisionnement en électricité fiable et durable. Le projet soutiendra le renforcement des connexions "inclusives et vertes" par la distribution et l'installation gratuites de "ready-boards » (tableaux de connection électrique prêts à l’emploi) destinés aux ménages les plus vulnérables (environ 10 % du nombre total des ménages) qui seront fournis avec deux prises de courant et un support de lampe, et par la promotion de l'utilisation de Lampes fluorescentes compactes (LFC) par chaque foyer nouvellement raccordé. Le projet améliorera, à terme, le bien-être et les conditions de vie populations, il stimulera la diversification des activités génératrices de revenus et contribuera à promouvoir une croissance économique durable et à réduire la pauvreté au Rwanda.

The overarching goal of the proposed project is to support the long-term and short-term development strategy and program of the government of Rwanda (GoR). The expected outcomes are (i) improved access to electricity for households and priority public institutions in the proposed project area and (ii) sustained reliable electricity supply. The project will support scaling up “inclusive and green” connections through the free distribution and installation of “ready-boards,” which come with two sockets and one lamp holder, targeting the most vulnerable households (around 10% of the total number of households), and the use of compact fluorescent lamps (CFL) bulbs by each newly connected household. The project will ultimately improve the well-being, living conditions, and diversification of income-generating activities of the population and contribute to promoting sustainable economic growth and reducing poverty in Rwanda.

Le projet d'amélioration de l'accès à l'électricité couvre les provinces du nord et de l'ouest du Rwanda. Le projet permettra de : (i) moderniser et réhabiliter deux sous-stations existantes dans la Province du nord, porter à 10 MVA la capacité de la sous-station de Gifurwe et celle de Rulindo à 20 MVA (station qui devra également d'être délocalisée) ; (ii) construire environ 464 km de lignes de distribution moyenne tension (MT) et 730 km de lignes de basse tension (BT) dans les deux provinces ; et (iii) connecter 25 438 ménages et institutions prioritaires (dont 179 écoles, 29 centres de santé et 25 bureaux administratifs sectoriels) au réseau le long des zones de lignes de distribution construites. La construction devrait être exécutée sur une période de 24 mois après l'entrée en vigueur du contrat, et s’achever en août 2017. Le coût du projet est estimé à 29,961 millions d’UC. Ses bénéficiaires sont principalement les populations rwandaises vivant dans les zones rurales qui auront accès à une électricité moins chère, fiable et durable ainsi qu'à des services améliorés.

The proposed Scaling-Up Energy Access project covers the Northern and Western provinces of Rwanda. The project will: (i) upgrade and rehabilitate two existing substations in Northern Province, the Gifurwe substation to 10MVA capacity and the Rulindo substation (also to be relocated) to 20MVA capacity; (ii) build about 464 km of medium voltage (MV) and 710 km of low-voltage (LV) distribution networks in both provinces; and (iii) connect 25,438 households and priority institutions (179 schools, 29 health centers and 25 sector administration offices) to the grid along the constructed distribution network areas. Construction is expected to be implemented over a period of 24 months after contract effectiveness and to be completed by August 2017. The project’s cost is estimated at UA 29.961 million. Its beneficiaries are mainly rural Rwandans, who will gain access to cheaper, reliable and sustainable electricity and related improved services.

title.narrative: Sustained reliable electricity supply - Rolling average of monthly interruptions per km of MV lines
Contractor workers sensitised about HIV/AIDS prevention
Direct jobs were created during construction period - of which are for women
Sustained reliable electricity supply - National grid system losses
Improved access to electricity for Schools in the Project area - new connections
Technical Assistance (TA) for institutional capacity strengthening - staff trained
Improved access to electricity for households in the Project area - new connections
Improved access to electricity for Health Centres (HCs) in the Project area - new connections
MV line distribution network construction for access scale-up
Improved access to electricity for Local Administrative Offices in the Project area - new connections
Execution of the ESMP and Abbreviated Resettlement Action Plan (ARAP)

actual.value: 6173 Project Affected Persons (PAPs) of which 6 were physically displaced

title.narrative: Direct jobs were created during construction period - of which are semi/low-skilled

target.value: Four (4) progress reports per year prepared by the supervision consultant
One audit report, each year completed within six months after the end of the FY in question. (A total of 8 reports is expected)

actual.value: One audit report, each year completed within six months after the end of the FY in question. (In total, 7 reports have been received)

title.narrative: Rehabilitation and upgrade of Gifurwe 110/30 kV 10 MVA substation

target.value: Rehabilitate the obsolete substation and install a new 10 MVA 110/30 kV transformer

actual.value: Rehabilitated the obsolete substation and installed a new 10 MVA 110/30 kV transformer

title.narrative: Relocation and upgrade of Rulindo 110/30 kV substation

target.value: Relocate the site and upgrade the substation from 3 MVA to 20 MVA

actual.value: Relocated to a new site and constructed a new 20 MVA, 110/30 kV substation
